# {{mul-kangxi radical-def}}

====Usage notes====
行 itself is also used as a radical (in addition to [[彳]]); unusually for radicals, the phonetic is placed in the ''middle'' – with 彳 on the left and 亍 on the right – corresponding to the phonetic originally being placed at the middle of the intersection.

====Derived characters====
* [[Index:Chinese radical/行]]
* [[鵆]]

==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} – a street intersection.

Originally symmetric, it has been simplified asymmetrically; the left half {{zh-l|*彳}} is widely used as a radical, while the right half {{zh-l|*亍}} finds occasional use, and the character can be broken up as {{Han compound|彳|亍|t1=small step}}, though originally it was not a compound.

====Definitions====
{{zh-hanzi}}

# {{lb|zh|literary|or|dialectal}} to [[walk]]
# to [[go]]; to [[move]]
# to [[carry out]]; to [[execute]]
# to [[perform]] (a salute)
# [[OK]]; [[good]]
#: {{zh-x|行，就 這麼 定 了。|OK, it's a deal.}}
# to be [[good]]; to [[work]]
#: {{zh-x|我 覺得 這 方法 行。|I think this will work.}}
# to be [[good]] (opposed to bad) (usually in negative sentences, or with {{m|zh|還}})
#: {{zh-x|我 成績 不 行。|I have bad grades.}}
# to be [[able]] to do something (usually mentioned before)
#* {{zh-x|他 能 四 分鐘 跑 一 公里，我 不 行。|He can run a kilometer within 4 minutes. I can't (do that).}}

=====Usage notes=====
Notice that when meaning “be able to do something”, {{lang|zh|行}} can only be used without a complement. This is different from {{zh-l|能|to be able to (do something)}}.
